UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's profile in the VaSa application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserProfile entity.

progress.description: Overall progress of the user in the app (e.g., completion percentage).

JobPost.title: JobPost
JobPost.description: Represents a job posting created by an employer.

id.description: Unique identifier for the JobPost entity.

employerId.description: Reference to UserProfile of the employer who created the job post. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N JobPost)

skillsRequired.description: List of skills required for the job.

LearningModule.title: LearningModule
LearningModule.description: Represents a learning module available in the Learning Hub.

id.description: Unique identifier for the LearningModule entity.

contentUrl.description: URL of the learning module content.

UserLearningProgress.title: UserLearningProgress
UserLearningProgress.description: Represents a user's progress in a specific learning module.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserLearningProgress entity.

progress.description: Progress of the user in the learning module (e.g., completion percentage).

completed.description: Indicates whether the user has completed the learning module.

Team.title: Team
Team.description: Represents a team created by users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Team entity.

memberIds.description: References to UserProfiles who are members of the team. (Relationship: UserProfile N:N Team)

ownerId.description: Reference to UserProfile who created the team. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Team)

EmergencyContact.title: EmergencyContact
EmergencyContact.description: Represents an emergency contact for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the EmergencyContact entity.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the emergency contact.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging, adhering to the core design principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and QAPs (Rules are not Filters). Authorization Independence is achieved through denormalization. For instance, team membership is managed via a membership map within the team document itself, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules. Segregation of data based on access requirements is implemented by storing user profiles in `/users/{userId}`, ensuring that only the authenticated user can access their own profile data. QAPs are supported by using the path-based ownership model and membership maps for collaborative entities.

The structure uses consistent patterns for authorization. Private data is stored under user-specific paths (e.g., `/users/{userId}/emergency_contacts/{contactId}`). Collaborative data, such as teams, uses a membership map (`members: {uid1: "role", uid2: "role"}`). Global roles are managed via the existence of documents in dedicated collections.

Explicit state modeling is encouraged with a dedicated `status` field where applicable. Predictable schemas with static keys and radical consistency in naming conventions enhance debuggability and maintainability.
